subject: p16508811
Findings: In comparison with the study of, there is continued enlargement of the cardiac silhouette with congestive failure. Poor definition of the hemidiaphragms is consistent with bilateral pleural effusion and compressive atelectasis. There is an area of more coalescent opacification in the right upper zone that is asymmetric with the opposite side. In the appropriate clinical setting, this could well represent a developing focus of pneumonia.
